en.value: According to lifestyle specialists, the less strenuous medical course is:
en.comp:
Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the question that follows:

(1) In the fourth year of medical school, I watched as, one by one, many of my classmates elected to specialize in less demanding areas e.g. radiology or dermatology and applied for their residencies. Puzzled by that, I gathered data from several medical schools and saw that the trends were the same. By the end of medical school, most students tended to focus on 'lifestyle' specialists - these with more humane hours, higher salaries and lower pressures - the idealism of their medical school application essay tempered or lost. 99% select their jobs according to the pay, work environment, hours etc. However, putting lifestyle first is how you find a job-not a calling.

(2) The incident which made me decide neurosurgery as my speciality was when I listened in awe as a pediatric neurosurgeon sat down with the parents of a child, with a large brain tumour, who had complained of constant headaches for some time.

(3) As it happened, the child's mother was a radiologist and had already studied the scans and was devastated. The tumour looked malignant and malignant tumours are generally cancerous. They spread to distant sites via the bloodstream. This spread is called metastasis which can occur anywhere in the body and most commonly is found in the liver, lungs, brain or bones. Its cure is not possible and the treatment can be used to improve symptoms and prolong life.

"Is it as bad as it looks"?, the mother asked.

"I don't know" the surgeon said, "But I do know that your life is going to change. This is going to be a long haul. You have got to be there for each other, but you have also got to rest. This kind of illness can either bring you together or it can tear you apart.

en.value: A teacher is providing appropriate assistance to students so that they may achieve something beyond what they could achieve on their own. He is _________&nbsp;the students.&nbsp;
Grammar should be taught:&nbsp;
Which of the following statements about the narrator is true?&nbsp;
en.comp:
Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the question that follows:

(1) An act of kindness is giving your best self to others without requests or promises of a return on investment. It is simply doing something nice for someone else, without them asking, without you doing it for anything in return. But all the same, they can brighten someone's day. Keeping an eye out for the opportunity to be kind can work wonders for a stressed-out mind, moving your focus from yourself to your place in the wider world and giving some much-needed unexpected help to someone. I experienced one such act of kindness the other day.

(2) It was a sunny day and I walked back home after school. When I stood in front of my gate, I was shocked to realise that the house key was missing from my bag, I had no recollection of where and when I had taken it out of my bag. It was a disaster because I had only one key and my parents had gone out of city for a few days. I walked around the society hoping to find the lost key but in vain. Having no alternative I called my mom. She was very annoyed at first and blamed me for being so careless. I was in tears and felt sorry for everything. Then my mom told me to go to my aunt's house who lives in another block in the same society. I was reluctant but had no choice. I went to my aunt's house to stay there for the night.

(3) The next morning, while going to school, I saw something shining in the window of the security guard's room. It was my lost key. I was quite surprised as I held the key in my hand. The guard told me that someone had picked up the key and deposited it yesterday in the office. Though nothing unusual, it meant so much to me. I cannot express my thanks to the person who helped me to get my key back. But I can pass on this act of kindness by following in his/her steps to help others. Studies show that being kind actually makes you happy as it releases endorphins and lights up the pleasure and reward centres in your brain. Take a tiny portion of your day to put a smile on someone's face.

options.value: He came from a rich family.
His aunt also worked in school.

en.value: Which of the following statements is Not Correct?&nbsp;
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the question that follow.

(1) One knows that 'The Taj' is amongst the world's wonders. It is one amongst the UNESCO World Heritage Sites! It is a legend of eternal love of an emperor for his favourite queen. It is a sad and beautiful love story. If it didn't exist, we would easily imagine that the story of its construction was simply a fairy tale. Many years ago, there lived an emperor called Shah Jahan, whose wife was a beautiful and bright woman, whom he loved greatly. Her title was Mumtaz Mahal which is a shortened form of Taj Mahal meaning 'Pride of the palace'.

(2) In the year 1630, this beloved wife of the emperor died. He was so heart broken that he thought of giving up his throne. Out of love for his wife, he decided to build for her the most beautiful tomb that had ever been built. He planned to build a unique monument and for this he summoned the best artists and architects from India, Turkey, Persia and Arabia. And finally a design was prepared as per the emperor's wishes. It took more than twenty thousand men who worked over a period of 18 years to build one of the most beautiful buildings in the world.

(3) The Taj has a pathway beside the reflecting pool with fountains upto the mausoleum created in soft and pure marble and jewelled with semi precious stones, where in the serenity of paradise rests the queen in peace. One can enjoy here the grace of perfection of proportions and grandeur of geometrical patterns of well appointed gardens enhancing the poise of the whole complex. They add magnificence to the delicacy of this monument of love, dedication and purity.

(4) The emperor planned to build an identical tomb of black marble for himself on the other side of the river. However, his son put him into prison long before he could get the tomb finished. So for many long years, till his death, he could simply gaze across the river at the tomb of his beloved wife.

options.value: Taj Mahal is one of the wonders of the world.
The Taj is one of the UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
The real name of Shah Jahan&#39;s wife was Mumtaz Mahal in whose memory The Taj was built.
Taj Mahal represents a sad and beautiful love story.
